one_reviews_text: black screen
I just gt the beginning where you pick out if your standing or sitting then just a black screen after that. :/
just a black screen
New age storytelling
I couldn't see anything
A great experience.

It is so poignant! It does in a little over 10 mins what some movies can't do in 3 hours.  All while making you feel like you are inside a painting that moves.  It is so artistically made.  There are no words to describe how beautiful it is.  

The only confusing bit was the beginning since as other reviewers mentioned it seems to start paused so you have to press a button to unpause it.  Other than that it was perfect, emotional and an amazing experience.  20/10.

Stunningly beautiful 3D art, great sound & music, touching story. Features viewing experience options ("Walking" or seated) and 360 degree viewing experience. One of the best VR short films available right now - a must watch!
really great animation

I started at a black screen like many others. After some button mashing it was the X button that unpaused it and it started playing. It doesn't seem paused as some atmosphere sounds are playing around you, which might trow people off.

Anyway, once underway it is some emotional loaded rollercoaster movie/drawing. I cried a little. It's very gripping and takes advantage of VR in a very new way, new to me at least. For free it's a must have.
Loved this. Beautiful graphics, poignant storyline and lovely music. Go on - immerse yourselves....
For some reason you have to press x to start the experience, otherwise you’ll be staring at a black screen with some music playing

Edit 10-17-20  Finally got it working a couple months ago so I thought I would update this and change my rating to a solid 5 stars.  This is a very emotional and creative experience which I felt was well worth the view.  In fact, since I got it working, I have watched it through more than a few times.  It's that well done.

Edit 05-04-2020  DEVS - any chance of addressing this issue?  I'd sure like to see this.

Bummer.  I got the Walking or Seated option and then the title screen but after that, nothing.  And yes - I too, have the gaming computer and bandwidth from hell so that isn't the issue.

review_title: Stunning 360 deg 3D artwork with a story
one_reviews_text: Truely fantastic art evolving around you 360 deg and above and below in 3D, probably better standing as sitting makes it hard to turn around and view everything, it evolves around you so good to be able to follow the art change easily. Its very stylised, great concept. No probs running on the Rift with ave machine.

review_title: Yeah, not working for me either ...
one_reviews_text:
Ahhh, too bad ...  using a Rift S, fast cpu, very fast network, and a 2080ti ....

Too many folks having a problem for this to be just a quirk - must be some bad bed-bugs in this one!

There's a lot to love in VR but this is something truly special. Not only do you get a touching story, not only do you get gorgeous artwork, but you get to see it all drawn around you as the story unfolds and can move around and view the artwork in full 3D. This is an entirely new art form unfolding before our eyes and it moved me like nothing else has. If you have access to VR and haven't experienced this, you're doing it wrong.

Can be played on Revive. The newer versions of Revive aren't working for me but the older versions still play this fine.

review_title: good 10 to 15 minute short touching film
one_reviews_text: glad i watched it, but angelica sounds like a dude
The screen goes black after I choose either sitting or walking. I have a Rift S with a good computer (RTX 2080 Ryzen 7 2700 X...)

review_title: This is art, this is amazing, this is VR
one_reviews_text: For free? Get it and be amazed.

My wonderful mother passed away from cancer at the age of 49. My father had a heart attack and passed a year later.  I was with my mother as she passed, but wasn't around when my father passed. I'm 52 now, and never a day goes by when I don't think about them.
If you are getting a black screen, then check your network connection.
I tried seated and standing, and got a black screen with audio on both. I quit and was just about to give up when I noticed my internet connection was down. After fixing it, I decided to try again.
This time it worked.
I'm glad I persevered.

It lets me pick my mode (seated) and displays it by Story whatever, then all the usb ports on my system turn off. Have to do a hard shutdown since I have no interface (mouse or track pad). Tried several times. Haven't had another game do this.
Does not work...Black screen
Wow.  What an emotional and beautiful story.  Emersion at its finest using Quill.  Can't wait to see it again.

review_title: Black Screen as well, not able to play
one_reviews_text: I have the same problem as JonnyTenebrous, the screen goes black after I choose either sitting or walking. Try to re-installed, but still failed to play the experience. It's not working at all.
Weird, colourful, strange. Not really my kind of animation.

review_title: The most awesome emotional Rift art
one_reviews_text: I lost my mother 12 years ago, way too soon, this app always gets to me. BTW, in case you experience black screen, try to close the app and start it again. And maybe standing works best - at least I just tried to app and chose sitting, and got a black screen. Then I closed the app, restarted it and chose standing - and suddenly it worked perfectly.
Beautiful and moving. A must see... especially since it's free. It's also a great example of what's possible with Quill.
Best experience so far, very touching T_T

The software starts up and gives me a choice of watching this in Standing or Sitting mode.  Either one I choose, the screen goes black and that's the way it stays until I quit out (even though I can hear sound in the background).  Basically, it didn't work.

This is the first app I leave a rating for just because its stunningly beautiful! I couldn't help but gasp at the scenes presented to me. Its an absolute artpiece in every aspect. Don't fool yourself thinking this can't be any good because its free. Its fantastic and you should go enjoy it right now!
shows only black screen. can hear sound though
If you are using Touch Controllers, press X to activate the experience. It is worth it!
I'm completely blown away by the artistic rendering in VR world. Must have for Rift owners!
Incredibly beautiful!

I loved the visuals and the emotions that were portrayed in this short movie. It was very touching. Thank you!   

And to those getting just a black screen (hit the x key if you're using touch), that starts the experience.

review_title: A glimpse into future of VR stories
one_reviews_text: Won't spoil what this is, because it's a short experience, at about 10 minutes long. There are some minor audio issues, but the visuals and story telling are absolutely wonderful, for the perfect price (free). This is what the future of VR story telling should be.

as someone who truly appreciates art and to experience it in such a unique VR fashion was quite inspiring. Ive only used Quill a handful of times and cant imagine how much time and effort went into this project showcase. During the credits you do get an idea of just how many people worked on this unique artistic vision. I'd recommend anyone who enjoys any art form to simply try this out as its free and a much better VR experience than what you normally find

I am blown away. A wonderful story and a great idea. What completely threw me for a loop was how well the whole thing directed my eye gaze. I haven't seen any VR experience so well crafted to direct the viewer's gaze. This film will define VR storytelling for years to come.
I hear faint music but no visuals

First time i post a coment about a VR experience but this time i had to.
This is almost the most magical and beautiful i have ever see .
Hope to see more in the future!!

review_title: Just watch and try not to tear up.
one_reviews_text: What a beautiful use of what you can really do with VR as a visual artist. Only takes 15 minutes of your time -  just watch!
A very cool, very emotional story told through hand drawings made in VR. I can't begin to fathom the talents of these artists, truly breathtaking. Overall a very cool experience. Bravo.

WOW...I truly enjoy these type of story VR experiences.   Henry was my first one and it was great, but this one is amazing.  I sure hope more like this will follow...such a creative way to tell a story.  Just beautiful.

At start i was "meh, why does it have nearly five stars", but then it's getting better and better, with beautiful animations and it finally reaches our emotions. I really liked the  comics/hero part :)
I'm still fairly new to VR but this was an amazing job of storytelling.  I hope I can find more experiences like this, because this is exactly what I want from this medium.
Visually impressive story drawn in Quill. Actual content of the storyline is lacking. Interesting to say the least.
i couldnt see anything after the startup selection. everywhere was black.
You have to try it, nice story but sometimes i dont cant see anything because i have to cry :/
Try it, please...
graphics are amazing, but got bored
Made me shed some tears :..(
Beautiful immersive graphics, but did not watch until the end
Perfection!  I cried like a baby.  VR can evoke such emotion.
best looking storyteller so far
Feels much more emotional than most VR experiences. Amazing art style, decent narration. Well worth checking out.
Its unbelievable a unique experience.

I am not a big fan of VR experiences and usually prefer games... But masterpieces like this really shows us the true potential of VR!
The "being inside" feeling is so powerful that it takes only minutes for the story to completely overwhelm your sensors and feelings!
......
PS: I've got feeling the XXI is finally here (yet the flying cars are still to be invented XD )

It is ART!! Pure and simple. 

Well, it's my view of artwork in the 21st Century. Stunning, if you can let yourself go and be enveloped in the music and Artwork.

5* all the way. More please. 

Can't believe I'm off to kill Zombies now....;-)
Magnificent! One of a kind storytelling you can only get in VR. Artwork, audio, the emersion standing up and looking around just sucked me right in!
Actually teared up a bit watching this.  So immersive and perfectly executed.

Judging by the other reviewers, maybe i stopped the experience a bit to soon. Might revisit in future. For now, i feel its pace is WAY too slow and there is not enough to look at. The lack of immersion threw me off.

It may be a short experience, and some aren't fond of the art style, but while moving around, following the story through the audio clues, it evokes exactly the right sort of emotional context. I really didn't expect the impact of this little visual adventure, but it definitely hit a chord.
What are you waiting for... just watch it.
beautiful！

Overall very nice experience! Sometimes the animation is too fast and it's hard to know where to look.

I initially experienced a glitch, I could not start (app did not respond to oculus touch input, even though my controllers were working fine when pressing the oculus button). Worked after restart. My guess is that if controllers are in sleep mode when app is started, it does not detect them when they later wake.
This makes you think that the future of VR is animations and movies not games.

Beautiful short experience. Everything works well, the art style, the acting and voices, and the music, and all successfully triggers your emotions in a good way. Be aware it's graphically quite intensive although it may not look like it. Many vectors on screen and it drove my previous GPU to its limits, the animation wasn't smooth, and kinda uncomfortable. Yet that GPU was decent enough for Robo Recall and Defense Grid. With a 1080 or equivalent, the experience is totally smooth and even more enjoyable. Highly recommanded.
This is a wonderful way to experience a story...well done!
After this story, I want to go home to accompany my mother and have a chat whith her.
Great VR experience.
This is very beautiful. It's free but after watching it, I felt like I should have paid something for it. Yeah it's short but you have to appreciate the time that must have been put into this.
Beautiful little short story with fantastic visuals. I can't wait for more experiences like this.

review_title: Beautiful in its way and engaging
one_reviews_text: It is always hard to review free experiences. Five stars would imply perfection and so on. Another "it's free so give it a go" situation but superior to most others like this. Genuinely beautiful artwork and a short but sad story that engages well. You have to be in the right mood to sit through it so just download it and run it when you want some downtime.

Compared to all these amazing reviews, I must admit that I've been disappointed. It's an art piece, yes, but a pretty empty one. And it is very short. Still worth looking... but I won't show it to others.

I wanted to enjoy this experience, but it only displayed the 'story studio' logo then went black.  There was sound, but no image after the developer logo.

P.S.  My PC exceeds this experiences requirements.
Manly tears were shed - that says it all!

This is different from the other VR expriences in that it tells a story, which is being drawn all around you. The graphics are nice, however the story itself is rather short and shallow.

One gripe I had was, even though I had reset my view, most of the action seemed to be happening behind my back forcing me to stand up and look around. Other than that, get it while it's free!

review_title: One of my best VR experiences
one_reviews_text: Actually more than an experience, for me this was more like a little journey.
Absolutely amazing experience

review_title: How to solve black screen with music
one_reviews_text:
I didn't experience crashes. But I did get confused about how to continue watching it when there is only music. 
Finally I figured that you need to press the menu button on your left touch controller (or the menu button on Xbox controller. It's called "start button" long time ago) to continue. When play the movie, A/X button can pause it. 
The film is really really impressive, definitely the best experience of 3D movie ever!
AMAZING! i want more !!

review_title: Beautiful example of VR as an art form.
one_reviews_text: This is on my short list of applications to show people of what VR is capable of. What a lovely little experience.
During the beginning I was thinking it was some pretentious emo shallow narrative, but I am so glad I was wrong. Made me cry too.

Great exprecience, great arts, nice timming! 
Thank you
All I can hear is the music and a black screen and then the sound of something going wrong on my pc, I look up and there is a massive error.
But it's a beautiful experience for people who love to feel sad, which just isn't my thing.
Great story and beautiful Quill style art
Tested almost all oculus games so far, but this one is very special. A truly wonderful experience!

review_title: A true GEM, but oculus killed the studio
one_reviews_text: Art and narrative deliver a powerfull experience. No Michael Bay style shooting or destructive mechanics. Kudos to the developers.
Tough subject-matter, but very well made.
Great Animation & Story...

Spoiler warning: It's about a kid who lost her mom.

That's... that's literally the entire story.
Tons of text to say nothing but:
"Mom I miss you, btw you were an actress and for some reason to this day I am still not over your death and I am watching all your movies to the point of being dellusional.

That's it, no she got over it, no impactful moments no nothing, this is all there is to it.

I disliked the animation style, I disliked the horrible font they used which isn't very readable at times, I disliked how there was nothing at all on the characters, just "Hi mom you died, you are an actress, kthx bye"

This would have been nicer had there been actual story content in this, there wasn't any, this isn't twilight bad, this is the first paragraph of twilight as the entire movie levels of bad.

THIS WAS NOT A BETTER LOVE STORY THAN TWILIGHT.

Save your time and don't bother, they could have at least made it look good to make up for the lack of story but nope, they chose a terrible art style.

Oh and it probably took you longer to read this review than the entire dear angela nonsense, so at the very least you got double your 0 dollars worth in content!

Side note: seems like a pretty sweet way to tell a story, now if only there was this thing called books that they could have used to animate literally anything at all... 

Here I got a sequel for you it's called dear Monica, here is the entire thing:
Dear Monica, you were my aunt and not Mom but you died anyway and also you were an engineer, you may not have designed any machine you ever built but I would still credit it to you, for example remember when you totally invented the television? now let's see televisions and what they can do, wow aunt Monica you are so amazing.
Also you died in the woods by a vampire.
His name was something from twilight and this is a better love story than twilight, also this is VR so we'll get away with this.

/endOfRant.
This is the most artistic and beautifull thing i've ever seen in VR, really a masterpiece
And it's free.
amazing story, made me feel a lot. And it's a true gem artisticaly.
I am sad now. This was really well done.
this was amazing and so beautiful, it made me feel so much!
better than the stuff from oculus studios. This is how stories should be told. Its like a painted dream. One of my all time favourites so far in VR! Go on with this, I would buy such stories!
Made me cry...

review_title: If it doesn't work, restart it!
one_reviews_text:
Do you know how annoying it is to cry inside an Oculus Rift? I do, now.

Well worth your time.
Loved this. Immersive and heartfelt. X

I've literally never seen anything like this! I was left bouncing back and forth between speechless, and just whispering, "holy crap" repeatedly, while my jaw remained dropped the whole time. Beautiful, inspiring, amazing... I don't have the words to describe this work of art, but the creators truly filled a virtual world with so many well thought out paint strokes, I could watch it 100 times and see something new every time (and probably will). The use of 360 degree space to create compositions that wrap around you not just horizontally, but also above and below you, and near and far was so well done! It makes you just want to dive into the paint strokes and literally wrap yourself up in the story. VR games are cool, VR videos are cool... this is something on a whole other level. Thank you for this masterpiece!
There has been a number of experiences to look and listen to! This one is a must, nice story and animation, Get it!

review_title: I wasn't expecting to enjoy this
one_reviews_text: Don't let the graphics turn you away like it almost did to me. This is an awesome experience and I highly recommend you have at least two sensors so you can move around and really get a close look at everything. It's a very touching story with amazing scenery.
Absolutely beautiful. Entertainment like this is paving the way forward.

Having messed a bit with Quill I can hardly imagine trying to make this entire animated film out of it. It is truly amazing how this is presented and well worth the view. Certainly worth showing off to show what you can create in VR.
I like stories but I didn't like the drawing style.
This is unique and new

Beautiful & Emotional. The only one drawback is not with the game itself but with the Oculus Rift. God rays are insanely annoying in this game. Neon lines on the black background - god rays are almost everywhere. So... Hey Oculus, why to put so crappy non-replaceable lenses in expensive device? It just doesn't make sense.
Using  great graphics for a nice little love letter to the power of imagination.

The concept is dynamite, and the visuals are impressive, but like Henry and virtually every other artistic demo on the rift, the story is artificially sad from the beginning. Their revolutionary new medium can immerse people in any story they can imagine, and this is what they've chosen first? Oculus artists, it feels like you're trying to impress other millennials instead of just making something fun for everyone.
omg what a great expirience! dont miss that one!
really nice drawing and speech. good actors. a relly touching experience
I hope tears arent bad for my oculus

I really didn't know what to expect, I hadn't even heard of Dear Angelica until today. I have seen Lost and Henry, but by comparison those are mere tech demos.

Dear Angelica is a 10+ minute SHORT STORY that is 100% hand painted in Quill, and it's absolutely stunning to see the characters and emotion being painted around you.

Audio is some of the best I've ever heard, and the combination of fantastic audio plus beautiful painting are awe inspiring.

One day entire 1+ hour "animated" movies will be made like this, and I can't wait.

10/10, would cry again.
An experience out of this world, you must have this.
Simple, yet emotional experience with a beautiful painted art style.
perfect
A strong reminder of how magical VR can be. This is something to show to your friends and family.
One of the best demos I've seen for VR yet!

review_title: Oculus Story Studio Does It Again!
one_reviews_text: Beautiful visuals with a touching story. My only complaint was that I was confused about the gender of the knight. I don't think it was intentional to have the knight somewhat masculine appearing.

review_title: Moved me to tears - the hype is real
one_reviews_text: This is not just a deeply emotional story of a mother and daughter beautifully illustrated. This is witnessing the birth of a new medium. Not only is it the first illustrated VR short using the groundbreaking VR painting/drawing tool Quill, but the effective use of scale and environment for storytelling necessitate the use of VR to achieve their full impact. For a time I was afraid to view it, thinking I had hyped it up too much in my mind and that I wasn't emotionally prepared for it. But it lived up to its expectations fully. Considering it's free and takes no more than 5 minutes to view, you have absolutely no excuse not to experience Dear Angelica.
A touching and artistically beautiful experience, simply a must watch.
Incredible experience and one that I have shown to many people to show the potential for the new forms of art and media VR can allow.

Not too bad a story with good voice acting. After reading the reviews I expected something a little more though. Good to know that it was made entirely through quill.  I found the seated position didn't work well and would suggest the sanding position is the best way to view.
My first VR approach and I can say that is breathtaking. A great concept and an incredible approach.
Yeah, I cried. Stayed with me for days.

What a breathtaking art style. I have tried playing around in Quill myself and knowing this is all done in Quill is mind blowing. Thank you for sharing! It is more a "thought" than a story so it might seem very simple in that regard. However the music and the art style is so breathtaking I actually teared up once the astronaut part started. <3 a Must see for all Oculus owners!
Rather short, but nice artistic exercise. Very touching story of a daughter remembering her dead mother. Don't watch if you're already depressed!

review_title: beautiful......how to make a vr story.
one_reviews_text: Watch this...looks great...has a story. sad yet beautiful.
Compared to Henry, Lost, Pearl, and Purge, I thought this was just "ok".  I'm clearly in the minority as most people seem to think it's great, but I would suggest you lower your expectations.
The graphics were all created in Quill... I recommend that you download Quill and run through the tutorials first... it will bring a richer appreciation for this short film

Graphical presentation is a true work of art. The story itself seemed a little lacking. No one seems to want to point it out, but there was something strange about this story. The writer(s) seem to have had the ambition to counter gender stereotypes. They did this by imposing exaggerated masculine stereotypes on the female protagonists. Instead of conveying "breadth of character" or natural androgyny, the picture they paint comes across as unrealistic and naive. It's kind of like doing something "contrary" as opposed to doing it right. So, for me, there seemed to be an elephant in the room that made the story less compelling.

This is what VR storytelling means. Forget the games, I would pay good money to see longer & similar quality movie experiences! Watch out when the colors come in - its mesmerizing and the art direction is in its own class! Enjoy!

review_title: The most beautiful VR experience ever
one_reviews_text: That made me cry so much. Thank you, Thank you, Thank you. I was in awe the whole time and after just losing someone who meant so much to me this hit me so hard. Thank you.

I've never written a review for anything  ever as far as I can remember but this story was absolutely amazing. I've seen movies with big time Hollywood budgets that didnt do a quarter of what this did to me emotionally. Thanks to all involved in the production of this.
amazing ! i would stay for hours watching this.

Henry and Lost were a great showcase for videos in VR but this goes to the next level. For the first time I have seen the power of real story telling in VR. Incredible experience, amazingly artistic and beautifully told. Given that its free this is a must for everyone to try.
New dimension of Art and space.

I highly recommend this short. It is visually amazing and transports you. This kind of storytelling can only be done in VR and its great way to show off the strengths of the medium. This short was expertly done. Enjoy!

Surely this a justification for VR as an art form and not just games or a 360 movie gimmick. I feel privileged to have experienced it at home in my own time, and not just read about it as people see it at Sundance.
beautiful experience. want more

review_title: A touching graphic novel brought to life
one_reviews_text: I found this to be a very poetic piece, and quite moving in places. Overall it brought the classic elements of graphic novel storytelling to life. It fell short of 5/5 for technical reasons with sound for me, the voice acting felt a little off and lacked the emotional impact the piece required but what a wonderful approach to VR storytelling. It definitely feels like a lot of love has been put into this. Well done to all involved.

Believe the cry-hype. Maybe this one just hits closer to home to me, but I have not gotten this emotional from any VR experience I've tried so far. I feel like I need to watch it again to really appreciate the beauty of everything happening around you. There's just so much detail and beauty in every stroke. A must download. Incredible.

review_title: Made us cry like a baby
one_reviews_text: Beautiful experience. It does a wonderful job directing your attention, so much so that you lose your sense of where you are.

This project broadens the horizon of story telling and it's potential in the VR medium. With a stunning, seamless, colourful (and musical) composition like this, it's hard not to take the potential of VR seriously. Huge step forward for VR creatives and whats to come creatively in the next couple years.
Oculs Story Studios have done the medium great justice. 5/5.

First time to have an experience to be "inside" somebody's story literally. A much efficient way to tell a story. (btw, this story is very touching) Totally WOW...  speechlessly smooth and stunning...the artwork is soooo beautiful (using lines to draw a 3-D picture... actually the whole 3-D scene.... incredible ) and that's an experience even better than in a movie(with dictated angle) cuz I literally use my own "angle/perspective/position" to see the story and create my movie in my mind based on the same visual environment. And I watched it more than once.

The narrative isn't necessarily a breakthrough but the presentation is.  On a normal 2d canvas this would not have as much of an impact but in VR it's like stepping into someone's thoughts and dreams.  The future of film and story telling is on an incredible path with VR.  I can only imagine what we'll see in the future.

This is one of those times where VR and great storytelling has just blown me away and left me speechless. It is a short story animated using Quill - or maybe I should say painted in Quill. The demo images in Quill were already fun, so if you have seen those you sort of know what to expect - except nor really! Because, with the added story, music, animation and emersion the result is just so much more than the sum of its part. Great experience.

What a wonderful experience! I had tears in my eyes and a lump in my throat, it was really touching. The ingenious artistic presentation is truly novel! It's like a kids's phantastic memory coming to life, where its mother being its hero fought the evil circumstances, riding on dragons into new adeventures, enjoying life to the fullest but then, finally, its mother has to fight her own demons (cancer?) which she sadly has to surrender to. Bravo, Story Studios! Dear Angelica is a true Masterpiece.

Non interative VR experiences are often interesting but nothing before has left me feeling so much. The artstyle is absolutely fantastic and the sound design is right on the money! One climax after the next of colour overload. Just when you think it's about to be over, it gets better. And the best part is the emotion it evokes. Bravo. Left me in tears. 10/10 -Nic Laporte

The artwork was beautiful. The story was a little contrived, but I give it bonus points for not being yet another cutesy Pixar-style short. So sick of cloying cutesiness in these storytelling experiments.

Note to VR filmmakers: first think of a meaty plot. Then start thinking about the medium.

This is amazing in every sense.  It's technically astonishing; just being surrounded by 3D illustration is a revelation.  The artwork is sublime, and the narrative is powerful.  There is little in the way of diegesis (even less than you'd expect in its brief ~10 minutes) but it is certain to hit you "right in the feels" unless you were gestated in a jar and decanted very recently.
That was a beautiful game.  It was touching, and visually stunning.  I can't think of another VR experience that pulled at my heartstrings like that.
If you think you are feeling way to happy, check this film thing out.  It will fix that problem right up.

It does a fairly good job leading the viewer from scene to scene but it can get a little confusing as to where to look next. A pretty relateable story too that isn't not long but it doesn't need to be. And of course the artstyle is pretty :)
I'd show it to dad but he might turn into a puddle lol.
Simply amazing. This is the kind of abstract content I've been waiting for.

First time ever experiencing something like it. You can really tell they thought about delivering the story in a completely immersive way at every moment. Art, music, direction, visual/audio cues, all added to the story - It's great to see something this creative in vr!
You may see 5 stars in my rating but I actually gave it 12 stars. This is the most immersive - if you are a gamer kid its not for you - if, however, you have a soul then this is what VR is for.

The experience was great. Blown away :)
I see great potential in this kind of story telling - i am not prone to motion sickness, however standing in the dark with objects, particles (and the camera) panning around might be hard on some stomachs. For me it was fine though!
Visuals are absolutely stunning and the story is great!

I bought VR for the gaming experiences, but I have to tell you that this short film was spectacular, and made me realize how much more VR is then just gaming.  Do yourself a favor and experience Angelica

Oculus hit a home run with the Emmy winning short "Henry", but "Dear Angelica" is on a whole new level of awesome. This is an example of how original and engaging VR story telling can be. I really enjoy being able to walk around this masterpiece as it unfolds.

Amazing use of art that give you the feeling of being in a painting.  The story and naration is great.

One major technical oddity in the most of the end of this was blurry and for some reason my Oculus was rather wet.   I also need to hug my family now.
Cant beilieve i just had the pleasure of that experience in the comfort of my own home and paid nothing for it.  Absolutelty stunning experience

definitively not my trip, i don't like to listen stories about love, false action, and poor graphisms, but the effect is cool, but well... there is no interest to watch this in VR, i don't feel transported by the story neither by the universe.
and very touching...

Just incredible.  It's hard for me to find words.  It's been the same experience with the previous two Oculus Story Studio stories, and Dear Angelica takes it to the next level.  

Glimpse the future of storytelling.

It's like a 4D comics in VR, a lot of details and impressive job.
very interesting and immersive. Worth the download.
Beautiful. An example of how VR can extend to emotions.

This is a beautiful, engaging expression of love and longing.  I was not thinking of the technology or the medium.  I was lost in this girl's thoughts and dreams and in an instant connected to her.  I felt her feelings.  Well done.

I am not kidding, by the end i was crying. The story is moving, sound design is perfect and the only thing breaking the flow of the experience was my computer, not able to process it smoothly. totally worth your time

review_title: Why so much fog towards the end?
one_reviews_text: I feel like the Quill artistry made this much more moving than a normal Live Action or Animated video may have been. Very touching. Very moving. Very beautiful. Can't wait to share it. Definitely a great VR experience.
Simply gorgeous. If you need to justify VR to someone, especially one that isn't enthralled by yet another shoot-em-up, this is it.

I loved the experience even though I think there is a large part of the story I am not getting the references to. It is a magical experience and I really hope more artists use Quill to make similarly presented stories.

Bravo.
Awesome VR movie, loved every second of it. I just did a review of it on my channel, search 'GametechUK' on Youtube for lots of reviews for content from the Oculus Store.
Technology is at its best when it allows us delve into our humanity, and this work of art does just that.
good story telling, strong 3D stereo feeling, and pen strokes like Van Gogh (?).

Honestly, this is the most beautiful and emotional thing I have seen on Oculus Home thus far. Also, to those that haven't tried; try watching it again but pausing at different scenes to see more of the current scene.

review_title: Brilliant exploration of a new medium
one_reviews_text: Wow... just wow. This is exceptional, completely immersive, and really demonstrates the story-telling possibilities of VR. Got my Rift all wet...

Oculus Story Studio continues to put out some really, really good stuff. Brilliant direction, captivating audio, and amazing art. And it all comes to life like nothing you've seen. Check this out for sure.
I am not prone to feeling emotional about most things but this was something else. You just have to see for yourself
When the world expands around you and brings you into the story, you realise that a tale like this couldn't have been told half as well in any different medium.

review_title: This is what VR Stories should be
one_reviews_text: Clearly made for and only possible in vr, this tale has you following around whimsical lines drawn by the artist that you won't forget anytime soon.
Really enjoyed this, felt like I could just soak into the experience. Didn't have to do anything but take it all in. Love to see more content like this, to this level of quality.
Not the best of Oculus studios, neither my style of story telling, but still a great job.
Crying while wearing a virtual reality headset is a new, welcome experience for me. Gorgeous art and sound direction.
Never seen anything like this before. Please give this a chance if you haven't yet. So very beautiful.
Definitely worth a watch, but for me really just a collection of 3D artwork in Quill. I didn't connect with the 'story' at all and I found the pacing rather slow.

review_title: Enjoyable, slow pace but great flavour!
one_reviews_text: Its nice to have the opportunity to experience creative content free in the Oculus store, another great reason to support the rift! I look forward to see other movies.

review_title: Boring tech demo with too much sentiment
one_reviews_text: These rough 3D drawings are beautiful. But combined with too sentimental story,voice and music, the experience became annoyingly boring.

review_title: VR storytelling trough art is amazing
one_reviews_text: I really am jealous of people who have that in their head and can now give it out for the world to see. The people who worked on this are amazingly talented.
I liked it better than Henry. Very emotional, and perhaps a bit on the sentimental side but it was beautiful nonetheless.  Great experience!
So good that I felt like I didn't even have the words or the qualifications to review it at the end. Dear Angelica needs to be experienced more than once.
This experience makes me realize how the small things are the ones that count.  Incredibly well made film, but it does establish a rather gloomy mood.
Original artistic and beautiful experience, couldn't have been created any better! Amazing
This movie was a punch in the gut. I was bawling by the end. Phenominal
This is how a story should be tould in VR. Very impressed!!!
Can't wait for Disney movies to be created in this format.   Can you imagin some of the old classics being redone like this?
Still sinking in...  Watch for yourself.  No reason to write words that fail to describe the experience.
How am I supposed to watch this when my headset keeps fogging up from all the tears?
This is what VR is all about. Beautifully executed, makes you feel something inside. Bravo.
Cried like a little girl, amazingly well done.  The combination of the narrative and rolling animation was breathtaking.
This is really well done and worth watching to see how something so minimal can be used to create something powerful.
Great way to show people the potential of VR and how amazing a medium it can become to tell stories.
Really, really cool. It's one of those experiences that you're going to want to show all of your friends.

I'm left somewhat speechless after whatching this Masterpiece. It's beautiful.
Get your hankies ready though ;)
Wow.. Stunning, and touching.. These are the kind of experiences that help build a better life.
Watch it once and delete, it's a good example of things that can be created but it's boring as hell.
So is angelica a transgendered girl? I don't know why but this movie gave me the chills. ._.
Extraordinary storytelling experience. Personally, no motion sickness condition during the display.
This is the VR experience you need to try. Hoping for more stories like this.

review_title: New way to look at story telling
one_reviews_text: Future looks bright in this new art. Can't wait till Comic Book stories start getting this treatment
The most immersive experience I've had in VR with a non-interactive story.
A great example of how VR is going to transform story telling. Beautifully done.
Nothing new or interesting about the story though. Another star because it´s free though.

My best VR experience so far, will be hard to match.
Thanks for this wonderful piece of art.
Fantastic demo of what is possible with the future of VR story telling.
Beautiful story of the relationship between a daughter and her mom. Very evocative.
A really nice experience. Because its free everyone should try it.
This experience has incredible emotional impact. Left me in tears... I'm speachless...

You have the helmet .. and Cry...What experience !!!!
Perfect !!!

review_title: Showing the power of VR story telling
one_reviews_text: It's like being inside of a persons thoughts. So powerful.
This is what Quill was made for. Truly amazing and special.
Good story telling, great voice acting, visually creative, and it's free!
A long time ago I did not see a short film that moved me so much
Sad yes, very moving... but so beautiful. Well done !
Wonderful cinema.  Hope to see many more like it.  Fantastic stuff!
The heart and soul is strong in this one!  Thank you Story Studio!
Beautiful in every way imaginable.  Thank you Oculus!
Great, it shows how Storytelling in VR have to be
Wow... just wow... must have heard and seen for sure
Shows what can be done with the right tools and direction
Great example of VR storytelling
Talk about an emotional impact :) This was great and gives a peek at the future of storytelling.
Visually stunning, story is flat.
I loved every second of it. Breathtaking!

review_title: More Impressive than I had imagined!
one_reviews_text: Very nice! Somewhat depressing, definitly ART.
i teared up a bit...
Beautiful, touching, amazing.
i miss my mom
It's simply incredible and beautiful.
The best of all Oculus VR shorts
That was absolutely beautiful.

review_title: completely new way to see a story.
one_reviews_text: completely new way to see a story.
Interesting
wow just wow
Simply stunning!
Thank you oculus
Simply amazing!
Amazing visual experience
Stunning piece of art.
Absolutly stunning
beautiful
eyes leaked
Thank you for bringing me to fairyland.
I got attacked by ninja onions
